content.question: In a certain small mammal, fur color is controlled by a pair of alleles, with <math alttext="upper case B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> being dominant over <math alttext="lower case b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The genotypes <math alttext="upper case B upper case B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="upper case B lower case b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> result in dark-colored fur, the genotype <math alttext="lower case b lower case b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mtext>bb</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> results in light-colored fur. A population of the species has the following allele frequencies: <math alttext="upper case B equals 0.85" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>0.85</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="lower case b equals 0.15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>0.15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If a fire caused the surface of the ground in the habitat of the species to become darker in color, which of the following claims about the impact on the allele frequencies in this population is most reasonable?

choices.label: The frequency of homozygous recessive individuals will increase because light-colored fur absorbs less heat.

The frequency of the <math alttext="upper case B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele will increase because light-colored individuals will be more visible to predators.

The frequency of the <math alttext="lower case b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele will increase because there will be more heterozygous individuals.
The frequency of both alleles will increase because the population will enter a period of rapid growth.

content.answer: The frequency of the <math alttext="upper case B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele will increase because light-colored individuals will be more visible to predators.
